results.title: Sunshine province
results.brief_description: Presents Nelson, New Zealand’s sunshine province, settled in 1841. Shows Nelson’s sporting and tourist activities: public historical buildings, sightseeing, golfing, surf beach as well as Nelson’s agricultural industries including tobacco growing and apple orchards.

results.title: Sunshine man : Changes face of farming
results.brief_description: Examines the development of the Sunshine Harvester by Hugh McKay, and the landmark industrial relations conflict in which he subsequently became involved, leading to the first Basic Wage ruling (1907).

results.title: Sunset country
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and David Corke
results.brief_description: A record of an expedition of 12 people who crossed a little-known area of the Victorian Mallee known as the Sunset Country to find out more about the wild life that lives there. Members of the party included C. Austin, R. Boswell, D.G. Corke, D. Holland, M.A. Howard, F.E. Lobb, A.R. McEvey, E. Molesworth, G.M. Pizzey, H.M. Ross, H.N.B. Wettenhall. Commentary by Graham Lynden.

results.title: Sunrise, Sunset: Moni and George
results.creator_credit: Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Some of the changes occurring in Australia in Australian industry. are examined in this programme. The episode looks at what has been the success of such changes. Moni, a bank employee, and George, an airport services co-ordinator, give their points of view.

results.title: Sunrise sunset
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: This program shows some of the changes currently occurring in local industries, tracing the development of the robot industry and the implications this has had for production costs and changes in job direction. Particular emphasis is on the importance of research and development - ideas and innovations.

results.title: Sunrise profession: land degradation hypothetical
results.creator_credit: John Nicholson, La Trobe University and John Nairn
results.brief_description: Part 1. An introduction to the School of Agriculture courses at La Trobe University, highlighting hi-tech science, state of the art facilities, applied problem solving, global issues, real world economics, innovative teaching and breakthough research. Part 2. An agricultural hypothetical teaching exercise on land degradation dealing with the salinity problems in northern Victoria.

results.title: Sunrise at midnight
results.brief_description: Sunrise at Midnight is both a documentary portrait of Yumi Umiumare, a contemporary Japanese/Australian butoh dancer, and a Japanese Ghost story set in the Australian Desert. The film is inspired by an historic photograph of a troupe of Japanese female performers who toured outback towns at the turn of the century, and the tale of one such performer, Noriko, who wandered into the desert and never came back. Filmmaker Sean O’Brien and butoh Dancer Yumi Umiumare make an expedition into the desert to experience and exorcise Noriko’s lost soul.

results.title: Sunpower
results.creator_credit: Shire Films, Barr Films and Dan Bessie
results.brief_description: An animated film tracing the history of our knowledge about the sun, also showing the ways in which the earth is dependent on the sun. The use of solar energy, emphasizing the power potential of the sun is also described.

results.title: Sunny Iceland: land of the vikings
results.brief_description: Shows the life of the people of barren but surprisingly warm Iceland: the green-houses which use hot springs; and the major industries, fishing and whaling.

results.title: Sunken treasure
results.creator_credit: Jacques Cousteau Productions and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Shows Jacques Cousteau and his crew exploring the site of a wreck believed to be the command ship of the 1641 New World Armada. Also shows the crew testing some new ideas about underwater archaeological salvaging techniques. Suitable for upper secondary level.
